data.body:
Shortcut to delete current line without saving to clipboard, uses Ctrl+Shift+K by default.

closes #9643

data.title: Autocompletion for inputEvent.is_action()
data.body:
**Godot version:**
2.1/3.0

**Issue description:**
When typing `Input.is_action_pressed(`, the auto-completion shows the list of defined InputActions.
Would be nice if this can also be made available for `InputEvent.is_action{pressed, released}()`
(In 2.1 it works, but only for `is_action()`, not the pressed/released variants.)

data.title: overloaded functions do not work in shader
data.body:
you can not write two functions with the same name like:
```glsl
vec2 some_func(vec2) {}
vec3 some_func(vec3) {}
```
they are supposed to do the same, but with different types, but you need to write two functions with separate names like some_func_2 and some_func_3.

this is not hinted by the editor, shader just fails and draws white shape on the screen.

is it intended or it needs fixing? in glsl you can overload functions.

data.title: Third take at making command-line arguments more UNIX-like + main.cpp and help cleanup
data.body:
Same as #10445 which was reverted, but so far I can't see what caused the problem that triggered its revert since I can't reproduce it.

This needs to be tested thoroughly before merging, I'm growing weary of the merge/revert ping-pong game :)

Please test and report any issue, including when trying to export (I believe the PR can be tested even with alpha1 export templates, the resulting binary would of course be buggy but the export process should work I think).

------

Help output:
```

  --path <directory>               Path to a project (<directory> must contain a 'project.godot' file).
  --main-pack <file>               Path to a pack (.pck) file to load.
```

data.title: No easy way to restore default editor settings
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux, Godot 3 master

**Issue description:**
I noticed there is currently no easy way to restore the default settings (per setting or globally) within the editor and project settings other than deleting config files and reloading the editor. I think this might become especially problematic for new users, because it's easy to mess things up and get confused or lost when playing around with certain values without any way of telling what the original sane settings were.

data.title: Switch back to project folder after making data folder
data.body:
This is in reference to #10454 

I believe I found the real root of the problem. There was a new bug exposed due to the bug fix in #8144 where the directory would never actually switch on *nix systems in the DirAccessUnix::change_dir function, but now does as intended.

So, the cause of the problem is that OS::_ensure_data_dir would create the data directory such as "/home/nathan/.godot/MyGodotProject" and then change to it and keep it as the current directory. The previous behavior is that it would stay in the current directory such as "/home/nathan/Projects/MyGodotProject". So, in my particular case it was looking for the C# assembly in the .godot user data directory instead of the project directory as it was correctly doing before.

What this code does is caches the current project directory location and then switches back to it once the data directory is created. This maintains the previous behavior while not reintroducing the previous bug. If the desired behavior is that the current directory be the project's directory in the editor then this fix should be the correct one. If the desired behavior is that the data directory should persist as the current directory and that the project directory should be switched to when loading C# assemblies or other files, then this is not the correct fix.

Here's a 6 minute screen recording in case you would like to see the issue in action.
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8iCxych7qVBdTlFVDNnc3BrNGc

Thanks!

data.title: improvement suggestions for AnimatedSprite
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, Godot Engine v2.1.3.stable.official

**Issue description:**
I worked a lot with animatedSprite in my last project and this has bothered me all the time:

1) not having the possibility to flip a frame horizontally/vertically
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10463138/29490584-f8a15dcc-8540-11e7-8ae7-055e92a3a974.png)
2) could not delete a frame with [delete] key (node get deleted)
3) after pressing on new animation button the animation text (New Anim) is not selected and cant be directly renamed
![animatedsprite_improvments](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10463138/29490676-7507386c-8543-11e7-9a58-89c5d293bcdc.gif)

4) selecting a AnimatedSprite node in tree doesn't show automatically SpriteFrames gui on the bottom when node has a SpriteFrames ressources (slow down the flow to quick edit an animation) (#10923)

What I'm not sure:

5. when animation only has one frame do I need to turn loop off or does the engine handle this automatically?

6. does it has an old discussion on having [Insert Empty (Before)] and [Insert Empty (After)]?
Its confusing and I need to consider with button I need to press.
Having only an [Insert Empty] and move the frame with [Up] or [Down] would be enough.

7. Is it possible to have button from animationPlayer?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10463138/29490866-08bc8020-854a-11e7-9a2e-92ee7fc70cf7.png)

data.title: Improvements to camera movement and freelook in 3D editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux, Godot 3 master

**Issue description:**
I've been playing around a bit with UE4 lately, solely to investigate what small things it has, that I'd really like to see in Godot, too. One of the things that I noticed I liked most is how smooth and satisfying the camera movement in the 3D editor feels as opposed to Godot (especially when using freelook). 

It's hard to explain, but there seems to be some sort of intertia or weight to the camera (similar to stabilizers in graphics programs) that allows for much more precise and less abrupt camera movement than in Godot. I played around with some of the editor settings in Godot but couldn't achieve the same effect. 

Unfortunately, I can't provide a gif for comparison, but maybe people who have used UE4 before (or possibly also Unity) can comment on this. Would it be possible to implement something like camera inertia for the camera in the 3D editor? I think this would greatly improve its usability.

data.title: Folder should be created automatically upon creating a project
data.body:
Godot will create your project in whatever directory you have set, meaning that you must create the directory you want your project to reside in beforehand. Unity, on the other hand, creates a directory named after your project for you, and creates your project inside of that. You merely have to choose where you want the folder to reside (e.g. a common "Projects" folder.)

This is a lot more convenient, and I think this is expected behaviour. Also, I can imagine new Unity users will be taken by surprise when their project files are spewed all over the wrong directory. For this reason, I hope this behaviour is implemented before 3.0 goes stable.

data.title: Crashes in PaymentManager.java (2.1)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OSX, Android
Godot 2.1.4-beta (commit e5102a9)

**Issue description:**
Sometimes I have crashes in PaymentManager.java like this one:

```
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): FATAL EXCEPTION: main
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): Process: org.asmstudio.spacecute, PID: 21854
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): java.lang.RuntimeException: Failure delivering result ResultInfo{who=null, request=4097, result=0, data=Intent { (has extras) }} to activity {org.asmstudio.spacecute/org.godotengine.godot.Godot}: java.lang.NullPointerException
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at android.app.ActivityThread.deliverResults(ActivityThread.java:3553)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at android.app.ActivityThread.handleSendResult(ActivityThread.java:3596)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at android.app.ActivityThread.access$1300(ActivityThread.java:151)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1369)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:110)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:193)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5292)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:824)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:640)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at org.godotengine.godot.payments.PaymentsManager$4.canceled(PaymentsManager.java:226)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at org.godotengine.godot.payments.HandlePurchaseTask.handlePurchaseRequest(HandlePurchaseTask.java:102)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at org.godotengine.godot.payments.PaymentsManager.processPurchaseResponse(PaymentsManager.java:228)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at org.godotengine.godot.Godot.onActivityResult(Godot.java:248)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at android.app.Activity.dispatchActivityResult(Activity.java:5456)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	at android.app.ActivityThread.deliverResults(ActivityThread.java:3549)
08-19 19:51:06.700: E/AndroidRuntime(21854): 	... 11 more
08-19 19:51:10.501: I/Process(21854): Sending signal. PID: 21854 SIG: 9
```

As far as I see the `PaymentManager.godotPaymentV3` is null but I have no ideas why. Purchases works most the time but sometimes not.

Maybe we should check `godotPaymentV3 != null` in every method of PaymentManager?

**Steps to reproduce:**


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
